intro: Faramea irwinii, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Faramea irwinii is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii and thrives in well-drained soils.
